interface.name: zphoc_device_state_v1
interface.description:
Phones, tablets, convertibles, laptops can have additional hardware attached or switch their operation mode from e.g. tablet to laptop. This protocol is meant to provide information about these changes to interested clients.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version. Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the interface version number is reset.
This protocol is meant to collect necessary bits before we propose an upstream solution.

enum.name: capability
enum.description: This is a bitmask of capabilities this devices has; if a member is set, then the hardware is present.

entry.name: tablet_mode_switch
entry.summary: The device has a tablet mode switch

entry.name: lid_switch
entry.summary: The device has a lid switch

enum.name: error
enum.description: These errors can be emitted in response to zphoc_device_state_v1 requests.

entry.name: missing_capability
entry.summary: get_tablet_mode_switch called on device without the matching capability

event.name: capabilities
event.description: This is emitted whenever a device gains or loses a capbility. The argument is a capability enum containing the complete set of hw capabilities this device has.

request.name: get_tablet_mode_switch
request.description:
The ID provided will be initialized to the phoc_tablet_mode_switch interface for this device
This request only takes effect if the seat has the tablet-mode-switch capability, or has had the tablet-mode-switch capability in the past. It is a protocol violation to issue this request on a seat that has never had the tablet-mode-switch capability. The missing_capability error will be sent in this case.

request.name: get_lid_switch
request.description:
The ID provided will be initialized to the phoc_lid_switch interface for this device
This request only takes effect if the seat has the lid-switch capability, or has had the lid-switch capability in the past. It is a protocol violation to issue this request on a seat that has never had the tablet-mode-switch capability. The missing_capability error will be sent in this case.

interface.name: zphoc_tablet_mode_switch_v1
interface.description:
The tablet_mode_switch interface represents a tablet mode switch. It can have two possible values:
The wl_pointer interface generates enabled and disabled events to indicate switch state changes

request.name: destroy
request.description: Using this request a client can tell the server that it is not going to use the switch object anymore.
